poem:
### Economic Forecast

In the land of tea and pensions,  
shaky foundations build themselves  
like houses of cards, teetering  
on promises yet to be kept.  
  
While tax loopholes waltz with retailers,  
interest rates whisper like rumors.  
Economists in their towers  
wave their alarms—  
small parcels carrying  
both goods and a nation's hopes.  
March arrives, uncertain,  
like spring outside an English window.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Economists warn budget built on ‘shaky foundations’; December UK interest rate cut looks more likely – business live 3.14pm GMT UK retailers are urging the government to move faster to close a loophole used by low-cost platforms such as Shein and Temu. In the budget, Rachel Reeves said the UK would end a customs waiver on parcels worth less than £135. The chance is expected by March 2029. But Helen Dickinson, chief executive of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
